page.title: 01Girvan Valley at Kilkerran
page.content: This area is part of the Girvan Valley. It is also part of Kilkerran Estate. Tenant farmers occupy most of the farms. The River Girvan flows from the north east corner to the south west. Gentle hills slope down towards the river on both sides. A railway and road run almost parallel with the river. The land beside the river on the north side is made up of small hedge bound fields mainly used for grazing sheep and cattle. Further up the slope of the hill conifers have been planted and beyond that the area opens out to moorland. The area south of the river is more cultivated. Barley, hay and turnips being grown . A number of well established hard wood trees are in this area.
